instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2879 Green Light, No Power
threads.message: I have a 820-2879 with no water damage, has a green light but does not power on.  All S5 power rails are present, but all S3 and S0 rails are missing. PM_SLP_S4_L is missing too and I believe this is what is responsible for enabling the S3 rails? Does U1400 create PM_SLP_S4_L  on this machine or is this the SMC?? I am extremely confused-any help would be great.

threads.title: 820-2879 Green Light, No Power
threads.message: Resistance to GND on 3V42 rails and both RTC Xtal pins?

threads.title: 820-2879 Green Light, No Power
threads.message: Read my post and try again....

threads.title: 820-2879 Green Light, No Power
threads.message: And I am getting .829 on both RTC Xtal rails

threads.title: 820-2879 Green Light, No Power
threads.message: I measured resistance to ground on RTC_CLK32K_XTALOUT and RTC_CLK32K_XTALIN and receive .829.

threads.title: 820-2879 Green Light, No Power
threads.message: I apologize Duke- but I am confused

threads.title: 820-2879 Green Light, No Power
threads.message:
RESISTANCE not diode! 
How are you turning this on? Are you shorting the power on pads on the board?

threads.title: 820-2879 Green Light, No Power
threads.message:
I went ahead and measured resistance to ground on the following rails:
PP3v42G3H_SW .299
PP3v42G3H_FB .681
PP3V42G3H_BOOST .596

threads.title: 820-2879 Green Light, No Power
threads.message: Red probe on ground and black on component in diode mode does not give me the resistance to ground??

threads.title: 820-2879 Green Light, No Power
threads.message: Yes I am trying to turn it on by shorting the pads- and also I tried a keyboard too.

threads.title: 820-2879 Green Light, No Power
threads.message:
I am still a novice at this stuff this is the resistance readings I am getting: 
RTC_CLK32K_XTALOUT 21.50
RTC_CLK32K_XTALIN 14.69
PP3V42_G3H 22.48

threads.title: 820-2879 Green Light, No Power
threads.message:
duke means he needs units.

22.48 miles per hour, kilometers per second, pounds, ohms, megaohms, degrees celsius etc.. ?

less than 30,000 ohms to ground on PP3V42_G3H usually means dead MCP(aka fucked). We can only determine this if we know what those numbers mean

the meter will usually have a little m or a k to denote million(or milli, depending) or thousand

threads.title: 820-2879 Green Light, No Power
threads.message:
thank you! 
RTC_CLK32K_XTALOUT 21.50k
RTC_CLK32K_XTALIN 14.69k
PP3V42_G3H 22.48k
all kilo ohms

threads.title: 820-2879 Green Light, No Power
threads.message:
Now measure from both of the Xtal pins to 3V42 bus.
Xtal pins to GND should be in the Mohms.

threads.title: 820-2879 Green Light, No Power
threads.message:
RTC_CLK32K_XTALOUT is 14.6 Mohms
RTC_CLK32K_XTALIN is 21.6 Mohms

threads.title: 820-2879 Green Light, No Power
threads.message:
PPBUS, PP3V3_S5, SMC_LID?
Does PM_PWRBTN_L toggle when you short the power pads?
Does PP5V_S3(L7260) come high after shorting power pads?
Check all coils for short to GND?
